Literature Review: The integration of mathematical programming in agricultural, natural resource, and climate change analysis has gained significant attention in recent years due to its ability to model complex economic systems and analyze the impacts of climate change on various sectors. Mathematical programming has been widely used to address the economic aspects of climate change, including adaptation and mitigation strategies. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of the art in mathematical programming for climate change analysis, highlighting the modeling techniques, conceptual issues, and major assumptions involved in using mathematical programming as a climate change economic analyzing engine.
